head.supplied: Excursion to the sand dunes of Eiderstedt ¶ in early August 1844. ¶ Probably during the first days of August; see M to Lars Hansen, 9 July 1844: 'I promise to commence my excursion to the dunes in 3 o...

div.p: The entries are not in chronological order, and not all of them are dated. Excursion nach den Sand-Dünen in Eiderstedt

Die Dünenkette, welche sich vom Eiderufer bis zum Dorfe Ording erstreckt und etwa die Ausdehnung einer Stunde erreicht, begrenzt, ein schützender Damm gegen die Fluthen des deutschen Meeres, die flache Westküste der Landschaft Eiderstedt, und liefern in botanischer Hinsicht einen der ausgezeichnetesten Punkte unseres Landes.

Schon beim Überschreiten des Eiderschlammes wird der Beobachter durch Zostera minor N. überrascht, an welche sich bald auf dem grasigen Vorlande der Dünen Plantago Coronopus L., Sagina maritima Don Agrostis stolonifera γ marit. (Lam.) Spergella nodosa Rchb und andre Strandpflanzen anschliessen. Am Fusse des südlichsten Hügels trifft man die ersten Eigenthümlichkeiten. Agropyrum litoreum (Schumach.) und nach den Bemerkungen meines verehrten Freundes Herrn L. Hansen zu HuesbyeAgropyrum acutum Röm. & Sch., Ammophila baltica Link, Elymus arenarius L., Ammophila arenaria Host, welche letztere schon von weitem durch die stumpfe, strohfarbene Ähre, und ihre niedrigeren Halme leicht von den Gattungsverwandten unterschieden wird, und in der ganzen Ausdehnung vor allen anderen praedominirt. Nach ihr findet sich der kräftig halmige Elymus am häufigsten, welchem sich Galium verum L, Carex arenaria L, Cakile marit. Sc. ß sinuatifolia DC., Juncus alpinus Vill., Halianthus peploides Fries und nach den Bemerkungen des Herrn Prof. Nolte in Kiel (conf. Nolt. Nov. fl. hols.) Juncus pygmaeus! Rich. zugesellen. Vergebens habe ich dieser Seltenheit lange nachgespürt, aber nirgends eine Spur derselben auffinden können; und daher gewinnt die Ansicht einige Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass bei jener furchtbaren Sturmfluth im Jahre 1825 das zarte Gewächs fortgerissen ist, was um so mehr zu befürchten steht, wenn der berühmte Finder a.a.O. bemerkt "& quidem iis locis, quae hieme mari inundantur". Auch Junc.capitatus Weig., an jenem Orte von Herrn Hansen bemerkt, konnte nicht von mir aufgespürt werden. In einem stehenden Wasser innerhalb der Dünen nach Ording hin vegetirt jene Pflanze, welche Koch für die wahre Ruppia maritima Linné's hält, während ihre Gattunsverschwesterte (R. rostellata Koch) nicht ungesellig die nahen Marschgräben bewohnt, und dann von einem Potamogeton begleitet wird, welcher mir den wahren P. marinus L zu repräsentiren scheint.

Von Potamogeton pectinatus L. (P. marinus Oed.) unterscheidet er sich wohl durch die zarteren Blätter und das gespaltene Blatthäutchen, von P. filiformis Schum. (Pers. synops. pl) P. marinus Fries durch die grösseren Früchte auch längeren Stengel. Die oft überflutheten Strandwiesen nach Westen hin sind mit einem bunten Gemisch von Blysmus rufus Link, Erythraea Centaurium Pers form. angustifolia, Centunc. minimus, Radiola linoidea überzogen, an welche sich noch Scirpus Baeotryon und Sc. pungens, Sc. bifolius Wallr. nach HerrnHansens Wahrnehmungen anschließen. Dann findet sich in den Niederungen, welche von den lockern Sandbergen umzogen werden, unter Weiden, welche in der gegenwärtigen Zeit nicht mit Sicherheit bestimmt werden konnten die Pyrola rosea Sm., welche hier ja doch viel später blüht und eine weit geringere Höhe erreicht, als jene welche man in Waldungen zu finden pflegt. Auf den nahen sumpfigen Haideplätzen wird Rhynchospora fusca Vhl von Litorella lacustris und Hydrocotyle vulgaris begleitet mit welchen sich bald die nahen Marschpflanzen vermischen.

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p: Excursion to the sand dunes of Eiderstedt

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p:
in early August 1844.
Probably during the first days of August; see M to Lars Hansen, 9 July 1844: 'I promise to commence my excursion to the dunes in 3 or 4 weeks'.

The chain of dunes, which stretches from the bank of the Eider to the village of Ording for about the distance of an hour's walk, borders the flat west coast of the Eiderstedt landscape, a protective dyke against the flood tides of the North Sea and, botanically speaking, offers one of the most excellent parts of our country.

Already while walking across the mud flats of the Eider the observer is surprised by Zostera minor N., which is soon joined on the grassy foreshore of the dunes by Plantago coronopus L., Sagina maritima Don, Agrostis stolonifera
γ
maritima Lam., Spergella nodosa Rchb, and other foreshore plants. At the foot of the southern-most hill one finds the first uncommon plants, Agropyrum litoreum Schumach., and according to remarks by my esteemed friend Mr L. Hansen of Husby Agropyrum acutum Röm & Sch., Ammophila baltica Link, Elymus arenarius L., Ammophila arenaria Host, the latter easily distinguished from its congeners from afar by its blunt straw-coloured spikes and short stalks and easily the most predominant species of the whole area. After it, Elymus with its robust stalks is the most frequent, associated with Galium verum L., Carex arenaria L., Cakile maritima Sc. ß sinuatifolia DC., Juncus alpinus Vill., Halianthus peploides Fries and, according to remarks by Professor Nolte of Kiel (cf. Nolte, Novit. fl. Holsat.
Nolte (1826).
), Juncus pygmaeus! Rich. In vain have I searched for this rarity, without being able to find a trace of it anywhere. This lends some credence to the opinion, that the tender plant was swept away in that terrible storm flood of 1825, which is all the more to be feared, when the famous finder notes elsewhere 'et quidem iis locis, quae hieme mari inundantur'.
'and indeed in those places which are flooded by a storm at sea'.
Neither could I track down Juncus capitatus Weig., also observed at this same locality by Mr Hansen. In stagnant water among the dunes towards Ording grows the plant, which Koch considers to be the true Ruppia maritima L., while its congener Ruppia rostellata Koch is associated with it in the nearby marshy ditches, where it is associated with a Potamogeton, which seems to me to represent the true P. marinus L..

It differs from Potamogeton pectinatus L. (P. marinus Oed.) in its more tender leaves and split sheath, and from P. filiformis Schum. (Pers., Synops. pl.
Persoon (1805-7).
)P. marinus
Fries in larger fruit and longer stem. The frequently flooded grassy foreshore towards the west is covered with a colourful mixture of Blysmus rufus Link, Erythraea centaurium Pers. forma angustifolia, Centunc. minimus and Radiola linoides, to which should be added Scirpus baeotryon
Scirpus baeothryon?
and, according to Mr Hansen's observations, S. pungens and and S. bifolius Wallr. In the depressions under willows, which could not beidentified with certainty at present, surrounded by loose
sand hills, Pyrola rosea Sm. is found, which, however, flowers very much later here and only reaches a much lower height than those generally found in copses. On nearby marshy heath areas Rhynchospora fusca Vhl is associated with Litorella lacustris and Hydrocotyle vulgaris, which are soon interspersed with the nearby marsh plants.
Excursion nach den Dünen v. St. Peter

in Gesellschaft des Herrn L. Hansen.
Undated, but probably in early August, during the summer school holidays, because Hansen was a teacher.
Aira uliginosa! Weihe, an Sumpfrändern zwischen St. Pt. u. Süderhöft innerhalb der Dünen in Menge.
Scirpus pungens Vahl aus den Strandwiesen vor der Bake mit Sc. ruf., ruf. bifol., uniglum., paucifl, glauc., marit, acicular.
Am Fuss derDünenhügelAgrost alb. arenaria N. & maritima Lam.
Juncus capitatus bei Süderhöft wo auch Nolte J. pygmaeus sammelte, zugl. mit Centunc. min. L. Radiol. linoidesGmJunc. bufon., J. supin;
Peplis Portula auf grasigem Moorboden in zwergiger Gestalt mit Schoen. fusc.
An der südlichsten mit dem Deich zusammenhängenden Düne bei Süderhöft in ziemlicher Menge Malaxis paludosa Swartz.
Innerhalb der Düne auf Heideplätzen zwischen St. Peter & Ording mit Tetral. septentrion albifl.
Zwischen St. Pet. u. d. Bake am Wege neben den Dünen Epip palustris Crantz.
Nach Ording zu auf den Strandwiesen Carex distans Carex glauca.

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p: Excursion to the dunes of St Peter

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p: Aira uliginosa! Weihe, on the edge of swamps between St Peter and Süderhöft, massed between the dunes.

Scirpus pungens Vahl from the grassy foreshore in front of the beacon, associated with Sc. rufus, ruf.
bifol., uniglum., paucifl, glauc., marit, acicul.
Scirpus rufus, S. rufus var. bifolius, S. uniglumis, S. pauciflorus, S. glaucus, S. maritimus, S. acicularis.

At the foot of the dune hills
Agrost alba
arenaria
N. & maritima Lam.

Juncus alpin. aggregatus.
Juncus alpinus var aggregatus?

Juncus capitatus near Süderhöft, where Nolte collected also J. pygmaeus, associated with Centunc. min. L., Radiola linoides Gm Junc.
bufon. and J. supin;
Peplis portula on grassy marshland, dwarf form, with Schoen. fusc.
On the southern-most dune continuing on from the dike near Süderhöft Malaxis paludosa Swartz, in fairly large numbers.

On heath areas within the dunes between St Peter and Ording with Tetral.
septentrion
albifl.
Tetralix septentrionalis albiflora?
Between St Peter and the beacon beside the road adjoining the dunes Epip palustris Crantz.

Towards Ording on grassy foreshore areas Carex distans
Carex glauca.

Obwohl das Terrain, dem ich meine Aufmerksamkeit zollte, nicht eben reich an Eigenthümlichkeiten ist, so gehen doch auch diesem Bezirke nicht alle Seltenheiten ab, welche in größerer oder geringerer Zahl fast jede Gegend aufzuweisen hat. An den Aussendeichen des Carolinenkoogs nahm eine Strandform der Apargia autumnalis meine Aufmerksamkeit um so mehr in Anspruch, als sich einige Ähnlichkeiten mit der Apargia Taraxaci W. auffinden lassen. Blätter und Schäfte sind kaum fingerslang und letztere sowohl mehr- wie einköpfig. Mit ihr findet man Sagina maritima Don gesellschaftlich, zerstreuter Erythraea ramosissima Pers. und Daucus Carota L (an den Deichen) bei welchen auch zuweilen Halimus portulacoides Wllr. angetroffen wird. Salicornia herbacea besetzt in zahlloser Menge die Eiderufer, aber nirgends finde ich sie mit S. radicans Sm. untermischt, welche von Herrn Prof. Dr Nolte an entsprechenden Standorten in Norder-Dithmarschen aufgefunden wurde.

Nicht fern von der Küste liegt eine durch ihre gelbliche Farbe ausgezeichnete Moorstrecke, die nach den Angaben der dortigen Bewohner bei hohen Überschwemmungen aus englischem Gebiete losgerissen und hier angeschwemmt sein soll. Ihre pflanzlichen Erzeugnisse kommen mit denen unsrer inländischen Moore vollkommen überein. (Rhynchosp alba Vahl, Andromed. poliifolia L., Molinia caerulea, Tetralix septentrion. Hll. etc). An den Ackerrändern imponirt Galeops. versicolor Curt mit seinen großen u. prächtigen Blumen, während die Gräbenränder mit Heracleum Sphondylium, Angelica silvestris, Epilobium angustifolium, Butomus umbellatus und Agrostis stolonifera besetzt sind.

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;
line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p:
Although the terrain towards which I directed my attention is not exactly rich in uncommon plants, even this area does not entirely lack all rarities, which can be found in larger or smaller numbers in every district. On the outer dikes of the Carolinenkoog
Caroline polder. The whole area of Dithmarschen is land reclaimed from the North Sea.
a coastal form of Apargia autumnalis caught my attention, all the more so, as some similarities with Apargia taraxaci Willd. can be detected. Leaves and scapes reach barely a finger's length and the latter are found both multi- and single-headed. Associated with it one finds Sagina maritima Don, scattered Erythraea ramosissima Pers. and Daucus carota L. (along the dikes), with occasional Halimus portulacoides Wllr. also to be found with it. Salicornia herbacea covers both banks of the Eider in countless masses, but nowhere do I find intermingled with it S. radicans Sm., which was found by Professor Nolte in similar localities in North Dithmarschen.

Not far from the coast lies a stretch of bog characterised by its yellowish colour. According to local inhabitants there it is supposed to have been torn away from English territory by high floods and drifted ashore here. Its vegetation completely agrees with that of our inland bogs (Rhynchosp alba Vahl,
Andromed. poliifolia L., Molinia caerulea, Tetralix septentrion. Hll.,
IPNI gives the author as E. Meyer(accessed 31 August 2020); the source of M's attibution has not been found.
etc.). Along the edges of fields Galeopsis versicolor Curt impresses with its large and magnificent flowers, while the edges of ditches are covered with Heracleum sphondylium, Angelica silvestris, Epilobium angustifolium, Butomus umbellatus and Agrostis stolonifera.

Die Vegetation dieser Localitäten stimmt mit derjenigen von Norderdithmarschen ziemlich überein, und es bleibt als weniger verbreitet nur Malva borealis Wllm. (beim Dorfe Hemme in Tönning´s Nähe) Myosotis hispida Schlechtendal (in der Nähe der Vorigen mit Ononis spinosa L) und Tussilago Farfara, welche letztere mit ihren ansehnlichen Blättern ganze Marschstrecken bedeckt, als erwähnenswert übrig. Scirpus maritim. L verleugnet auch hier seine Verbreitung nicht, in welcher er sich an der Küste der ganzen Welt zeigt und pflegt Atriplex latifolium Wahlenberg und Plantago maritima zu Genossen zu haben.

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p: Excursions along the dikes of Eiderstedt

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p:
The vegetation of this locality agrees fairly well with that of North Dithmarschen,
See diary entry August 1844, 'Botanische Wanderungen in Norder-Dithmarschen'.
and only Malva borealis Wllm. (close to the village of Hemme, near Tönning), Myosotis hispida Schlechtendal (near the preceding, with Ononis spinosa L), and Tussilago farfara remain worth mentioning as less common, the last covering whole stretches of marsh land with its handsome foliage. Here, too, Scirpus maritim. L does not fail to show its distribution, which spreads over the coasts of the whole world, and tends to be associated with Atriplex latifolium Wahlenberg and Plantago maritima.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; break-before: page; text-align: center;

div.p: Pflanzenzusendung vom Donnerstag manu Herrn L. Hansen, Organisten zu Huesbye im Mai 1845 für die im August u. vor. Jahres gesammelten Exemplare von Ammophila baltica (Lk), Hort (60fach) Ruppia maritima L. Koch (70fach) Agrostis maritima Lm (30fach) Blysmus rufus Lk (60 Doubl) Agropyrum litoreum (Schum) 60fach. von den Eiderstedter Dünen oder doch aus der Nähe derselben.

Thursday's transmission of plants from Mr L. Hansen, organist in Husby, in May 1845, in return for the specimens of Ammophila baltica (Lk), Hort (in 60 duplicates), Ruppia maritima L. Koch (in 70 duplicates), Agrostis maritima Lm (in 30 duplicates), Blysmus
rufus Lk (in 60 duplicates), Agropyrum litoreum (Schum) (in 60 duplicates), collected in August and last year on the Eiderstedt dunes or in their vicinity.
Ammophila baltica Link v. d. Ostsee

Zostera marina angustif. Fl.D.
angustifolia Flora Danica.

β. integrifolium
Variety not found.
. N.
Folgendes war in der Sammlung des Herrn Hansen nicht mehr vorhanden:
The following were no longer represented in the collection of Mr Hansen:
Ausserdem fehlen mir aus d. S. H. L. Herb. folg. Gewächse
In addition I lack the following plants from the flora of Schleswig-Holstein-Lauenberg

X
Various items in this list are marked with a small cross.
Carex distans L.
X Scirpus palustris L. v. Major
Schreiben an Herrn Häcker in Lübeck

Letter to Mr Häcker in Lübeck.
For the letter copied into the notebook at this point see M to G. Häcker, April 1845.

div.p: Mit wenigen Ausnahmen ganz instructiv von kleineren Pflanzen immer mehre auf 1 Ex. gerechnet. Das Verschiedene in Umschlag.
With few exceptions more than one plant has been counted as 1 specimen in the case of small plants. Differing specimens in separate envelopes.

incurvatus Fries
Theauthor of Lepturus incurvatus is usually given as Trinius;M's attribution to Frieshas not been idetified, although in Fries (1832-45), Mantissatertia, p. 181, he lists a variety. L. incurvatus v strictus.

div.p: Plants of Lübeck required from the most friendly G. R. Häcker (February 1846)

Names of pines or conifers. (cf. Allgemeine Gartenzeitung , vol. 10, p. 129)
A.Dietrich (1842). M copied only in extract, listing the European genera and their type species, with the most commonly used names for each genus, and the Linnean names here placed in synonymy. The published paper has in addition an introduction, some text at the end of the European list, other commonly grown species and their synonyms, and various German names applied to the genera and species in different parts of Germany. A brief list at the end gives extra-European members of this group for the benefit of horticulturists.
Zwischen Erfde und Norderstapel bei der zeiten Brücke (nach Nolte)
Between Erfde and Norderstapel at the second bridge (according to Nolte).

Capsula bi-quadrivalvis & bi-locularis dehiscens, corollae infundibuliformis limbo plicato, stigmate emarginato, staminibus inaequalibus inclinatus. Calyce tuboloso regulari, persistente, staminibus quinque hypogynis.
Genus Salpiglossis solum forma corollae differt, etiam Lehmannia, Petunia & Nierembergia genera affinia sunt. (Nierembergia R. & P. Petunia a Don olim conjuncta differt calyce foliaceo)
Ab Hyoscyamo dignoscitur corolla plicata, regulari; dehiscentia capsularum sine operculo, a Datura autim calyce persistente, stigmate capitato, capsularum loculis haud bipartitis.

Willdenowius in enumerationis plantarum specierum Linnaei editori quarta anno 1797 tantum species septum, in Persoonius in synopsisplantarum 1805 jam duodecimum, Römer & Schultesius in systemate vegetabile 26 spec. & Walpersius in additamentis ad Prodromum Candolleanum systematis naturalis species XLI enumeraverunt. Autor ultimus retulit plantas plurimas prius c. Nicotianus conjunctas ad Petuniam & Nierembergiam.
Species tres N. Tabacum L, N. latissima Miller (macrophylla Sprengel) N. rustica L. coluntus in Germania. Koch. syn. ed. II.
In cultis speciminibus fertilatas mirabilis invenitur, nam individuum unicum semina fert 40,320. Conferatur Willdenow Kräuterkunde 7 Ausgabe non Link pag. 500.
Nicotiana rustica Linné praecocius quam N. Tabacum Linné cognita olim ab auctoribus antiquis Hyoscyamus luteus nominator est. Species omnes plus minusve Nicotini pertinent.

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p: Commentary on the genera of the Nicotianae.

Capsule with two to four valves dehiscing in two sections, corolla spindle-shaped with pleated limb, stigma emarginate, stamens unequal, inclined. Calyx uniformly tubular, persistent, with five hypogynous stamens.

Only the genus Salpiglossis differs in the form of the corolla, the genera Lehmannia, Petunia & Nierembergia are also related. (Nierembergia Ruiz & Pav. and Petunia were formerly united by Don, differing by the foliaceous calyx.)

It is distinguished from Hyoscyamus by a uniformly pleated corolla; capsules dehiscing without ab operculum, and further from Datura in the persistent calyx, the capitate stigma, and in the locules of the capsules not at all bipartite.

Willdenow in enumerations of Linné's Species plantarum, ed. 4, 1797, gave only seven species, in Persoon, Synopsis plantarum, 1805, there are twelve, in Römer & Schultes Systema vegetabile 26 species, & Walpers in Additamente to De Candolle's Prodromus
Linné(1797-1830), Persoon (1805-7),theRoemer & Schultesedition of Linné(1817-30), Walpers (1842-8) vol. 3, pp. 7-13.
41 species are enumerated. The author
Walpers.
finally returns most plants previously united under Nicotiana to Petunia and Nierembergia.

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;
line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p:
Three species, Nicotiana tabacum l., N. latissima Miller (macrophylla Sprengel), and N. rustica L. grow in Germany, according to Koch, Synopsis ed. 2.
W.Koch (1843-5).

In cultivation specimens acquire a miraculous fertility, for a single specimen can produce 40,320 fertile seeds, cf. Willdenow (non Link), Kräuterkunde ed. 7, p. 500.
Willdenow (1831).The same information is in the edition of Wildenow edited by Link (Wildenow (1831a)), p. 530.

Nicotiana rustica L. along with N. tabacum L. were incompletely known by early authors and named by them as Hyoscyamus
luteus. More or less all the species belong to Nicotiana.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; break-before: page; text-align: center;

div.p:
Catalogue. Cryptogamic plants of the Fichtelgebirge, by Heinrich Christian Funck.
Spot checks at MEL show that M owned a setof exsiccatae ofthe first 15 decades here listed. The printed cover pages and notes on the contents that were issued with these decades were bound at a later date and are in the library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne. Where the following lists give synonyms, the relevant herbarium collections are accompanied by a label in M's hand, listing the synonym. So far no specimen has been found with any indication of when, how and from whom M acquired the sets. M later acquired further material of these exsiccatae, possibly as part of the Steetz and Sonder herbaria; it is not known how complete is the representation of these sets. The Botanical Institute, University of Kiel, has a full set of these exsiccatae (see TL2). For a full collation and description of the sets see Margadant (1968).

M's names and synonyms are not well lined up and it is not clear to which name he intended this and the next synonym to belong
Graphis aenea. W γ papulosa. W.
G. corrugata. W. α apythmenina. W.
P. scruposa W. α bryophila W.

cell.p:
vegetabile nullum!
Not of the plant kingdom. Hard growths or tumors, usually on leaves, are called xylomas. Xyloma is also a former name of more than one current fungus genus.

cell.p: G. alpicola Sw. β. rivularis Br.

Erysibe Anemones (F. M.)
The combination Erysibe Anemones has not be found in published sources. M's label for this specimen at MEL has the synonym Erysibe arillata penciled in.

div.p:
Pag. 249.
The description is copied from Fries (1849), p. 249, with omission of the cited sources.

Spica disticha arrecta, rhachi siccitate fragili, spiculis 5-8 floris, valvis lanceolatis 5-7 nervibus obtusiusculis, spiculam dimidiam superantibus, floribus obtusiusculis mucroneve brevi aristatis, culmo stricto, foliis carinato-triquetris angustis involutis patente strictis, superne velutinis scabrisque. — T. junceo proximum semper strictum, glaucum. Variat ut affinia spicis confertis & distantibus, rachi floribusque plus minus villosis, floribus muticis et aristatis. DC optime descripsit notalque characteres T. stricti (valvas 5 nerves flores pilosos) esse varios.
Vortrag von Hr. Conferenz- und Etatsrath Prof. Dr. Pfaff zu Kiel im Dec. 1846.

Über die Lebensdauer der Pflanzen herrschen im Ganzen dieselben Gesetze, wenn sie auch hier als höhere Potenzen wirken. Unter den Einflüssen, welche auf das Pflanzenleben wirken, kommt besonders die Cultur in Betracht, weil sie die Lebenskraft der Pflanzen zuweilen verlängert zuweilen verkürzt. Die vegetabile Kraft ist das Bestreben die Lebenskraft zur Verlängerung des Wachstums zu modificiren. Diese Kraft aber können wir uns nicht als etwas Immaterielles, als etwas vom Organismus Gesondertes vorstellen, sondern sie bildet in der lebendigen Zelle die Organisation.

Im Pflanzenreiche kommt die höchste Lebensdauer vor, kann man doch die Lebensgeschichte mancher Pflanzenindividuen bis zur Entstehung des jetzigen Menschengeschlechtes verfolgen, und wir kennen Bäume, bei welchen wir in dieser Hinsicht fast ein Infinitum annehmen können. Die Möglichkeit aber, durch Empierie das Alter der Bäume zu finden, steht nach mehrseitigen beweisenden Beobachtungen fest.

Kennt man die Gesetze des Wachsth[ums]
editorial addition — MS incomplete.

p.style: line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;
line-height: 0.1944in; font-size: 10pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: center;

div.p: Lecture by Counsellor Professor Dr Pfaff at Kiel in December 1846.

Generally the same laws govern the life span of plants, even though here they also act as higher power. Among the conditions which influence plant life, culture in particular must be considered as something which sometimes increases the vigour of plants, sometimes decreases it. Vegetative energy is the endeavour to modify the life force in order to prolong the period of growth. However, we must not imagine this energy to be something immaterial, something separate from the organism. Rather, it forms the organisation in the living cell.

The longest lifespan is found in the plant kingdom. The life history of many individual plants can be traced to the beginning of modern man and we know trees, where one can almost assume an infinity in this respect. But the possibility of determining the age of trees empirically has been confirmed through various proven observations.

If one knows the laws of growth [...]
MS incomplete — an unknown amount of text missing.
